item.title: Covid: Sajid Javid to give update on lifting measures in England
item.description: Sajid Javid, who replaced Matt Hancock, will address MPs on when restrictions will be lifted in England.

item.title: Matt Hancock resignation: Questions remain for PM
item.description: The government faces questions over ex-health secretary's use of private email and how his aide was appointed.

item.title: Portugal makes unvaccinated UK people quarantine
item.description: UK travellers will have to quarantine for 14 days while Germany wants EU to step up restrictions.

item.title: Canada weather: Heatwave hits record 46.6C as US north-west also frazzles
item.description: Lytton in British Columbia breaks an 84-year-old record, as the US Pacific north-west also sizzles.

item.title: Mother's plea after daughter dies swallowing battery
item.description: Harper-Lee Fanthorpe died in Stoke-on-Trent in May after swallowing a battery from a remote control.

item.title: Birmingham stabbings: Man admits Jacob Billington killing
item.description: Library intern Jacob Billington died and seven others were hurt during a stab spree in Birmingham.

item.title: US air strikes in Iraq and Syria target Iran-backed militias
item.description: The strikes against Iran-backed militias are in response to attacks on US forces, the Pentagon says.

item.title: Australia Covid: Outbreaks emerge across country in 'new phase' of pandemic
item.description: For the first time in a year, Australia is battling outbreaks in different parts of the country.

item.title: Heads of the Valleys: Frustration over 50mph limit plans
item.description: After seven years changing a busy five-mile stretch into a dual carriageway, its speed limit could stay

item.title: Greggs' sales recovery stronger than expected
item.description: The bakery chain says sales have continued to grow, while car dealership Lookers also enjoys strong trade.

item.title: Steyning illegal rave: Dozens arrested as thousands party in national park
item.description: Police say it was "one of the largest unplanned operations we have experienced in recent years".

item.title: The Papers: PM faces Hancock questions and Javid starts new job
item.description: Events surrounding Matt Hancock's departure as health secretary still feature prominently in the papers.

item.title: 'I'm just an ordinary old chap who wanted to fly'
item.description: A 106-year-old war veteran completes his bucket list dream of flying a plane by using a simulator.

item.title: Papua's sacred forest for women only
item.description: For generations women have gathered clams and shared stories in a forest that is now threatened by pollution.

item.title: Love Island: ITV2 dating show returns after 18-month break
item.description: After a pandemic-enforced gap, the ITV2 dating show returns on Monday with 11 new islanders.

item.title: The cat cafe helping homeless felines
item.description: Java Whiskers is Londonâ€™s latest cat cafe and is currently home to nine felines who have been looking for new owners.

item.title: Your questions about vaccines and periods answered
item.description: Find out what experts believe the short and long term effects of a covid jab will be on your period.

item.title: Euro 2020: England-Germany is chance to make history, says manager Gareth Southgate
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate believes Tuesday's last-16 tie with Germany represents an opportunity for his team to "make some history".

item.title: Worcestershire twins celebrate delayed 100th birthdays
item.description: Edith Dumbleton and Dorcas Tobin were unable to celebrate with family in 2020 because of Covid-19.

item.title: Somerset Glastonbury Festival fans recreate site at home
item.description: The Facebook event Glasthomebury was organised by festival fans to raise money for charity.

item.title: Ready to party? Ibiza's dance experiment
item.description: Key workers were able to dance in Ibiza's nightclubs this weekend, to test if they can reopen safely.

item.title: 'Was I just unlucky to get Covid after double vaccine?' asks Marr
item.description: The BBC's Andrew Marr fell ill with coronavirus, despite being vaccinated twice.

item.title: Anne Robinson on Countdown and cancel culture
item.description: The presenter is taking over from Nick Hewer as the host of Channel 4's daytime quiz show.

item.title: Climate change: Why action still ignites debate in Australia
item.description: Climate change has ended political careers in Australia and action over it remains widely debated.

item.title: Pandemic work stress: How I learned to deal with it
item.description: The disruption caused by the pandemic has raised fears of burnout, but workers are finding solutions.

item.title: Wuhan lab-leak theory fuels Trump comeback rally
item.description: Supporters say the former president was "dead on", as the theory about the origins of Covid gains respectability.

item.title: The tech helping parents look after their babies
item.description: A growing number of technology firms are aiming to help reduce the anxiety of new mums and dads.

item.title: Jack Dorsey: Unpicking Twitter boss's passion for Nigeria
item.description: The social media platform is banned but Jack Dorsey remains a hugely popular figure in the country.

item.title: Appeal to identify 'La Botaniste' who slipped from history
item.description: Who was the mysterious Isabella Allen and what was her contribution to 19th Century botanical science?

item.title: The huge NHS challenge facing Sajid Javid
item.description: The new health secretary must deal with massive waiting lists and exhausted health staff.

item.title: Outcry over South Africa's multiple husbands proposal
item.description: Critics say it would be "un-African" for a woman to have more than one husband at the same time.

item.title: 'Now or never for Belgium's golden generation' - but at what cost has Portugal win come?
item.description: After Belgium defeat Portugal in the last 16 of Euro 2020, is now their best opportunity to win silverware?

item.title: British number one Konta out of Wimbledon because of Covid contact
item.description: British number one Johanna Konta is out of Wimbledon because one of her team has tested positive for Covid.

item.title: Euro 2020: Thorgan Hazard's winning goal for Belgium against Portugal from every angle
item.description: Watch Thorgan Hazard's stunning winning goal for Belgium against Portugal in the last 16 of Euro 2020 from every angle we could find.

item.title: EURO 2020: Work-rate & bully ball - How Czech Republic toppled the Netherlands
item.description: Dion Dublin and Martin Keown analyse Czech Republic's attacking play in their 2-0 win against the Netherlands in the round of 16 at Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: Thorgan Hazard strike seals Belgium victory over Portugal
item.description: Thorgan Hazard's stunning strike secures Belgium a 1-0 win against Portugal in Seville to seal their place in the Euro 2020 quarter-finals.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Coronavirus restrictions are staying in place because of concerns about the Delta variant.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid: How is furlough changing and when will it end?
item.description: Furlough has been extended until the end of September

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: People who've had both Covid jabs may soon be able to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and receptions?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid: What are the care home visiting rules?
item.description: New guidance gives hope to people who want to go to see their loved ones.

item.title: What are the rules for pubs, restaurants, festivals and gigs?
item.description: The lifting of restrictions is being delayed, which could affect planned events

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as almost 44 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but could the rules change as lockdown eases further?

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Over-18s can get a first jab in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and second jabs are being brought forward.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Can we stop worrying about high case numbers?
item.description: As vaccination reduces serious illness from Covid-19, the Scottish government is changing its strategy.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Covid: How is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: Europe is gradually easing lockdown measures ahead of the tourist season.

item.title: Euro 2020: Why are England players self-isolating?
item.description: Two England players are self-isolating after a Scotland player tested positive for Covid.

item.title: Covid: Ivermectin to be studied as possible treatment in UK
item.description: Scientists begin to give the drug to people at home with symptoms to see if it can keep them out of hospital.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Gary Allen: The killer who nearly got away with murder
item.description: Gary Allen's conviction for the murders of two women brings a 20-year quest for justice to an end.

item.title: Wimbledon: Roger Federer's epic victory over Pete Sampras, 20 years on
item.description: At Wimbledon in 2001, a teenage hopeful took on the serial champion. It was a match for the ages - the only time two greats met.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?
